TopicTitle: Something Weird I found (KSP Fan Site )

Articles.Content:
I found this strange site that copied all of KSP and is acting like its selling KSP Parts .This site is just a fan page or something

Site : http://ghsgaming.com/index.html

THIS IS NOT A JOKE,I FOUND THIS MY SELF!

Update : Looks like nothings wrong!,welp,enjoy the website XD

Edited November 4, 2013 by victor tan

There is no shopping cart. They give credit to squad on the main site. It looks like a joke site. That's all.

Meh.
It's an odd site, but clearly it's some form of joke as you can't actually buy those parts and the prices are in the 100's of thousands.

looks like marketing to me?

not bad, nice find

oh and there is actually a shopping cart!

optional extras on checkout:

-gift wrapper

-include assembly instructions (voids warranty)

lol'd =)

Doesn't seem to be a real site as it has no real way of buying the parts. Probably a site that someone made to back up the lore inside their Space program in KSP. Its quite well done and I dont think the devs will be angry at this, at most they will be impressed by the ability of whoever made the site.

Peace

-EliteShadowLeo

Edited November 4, 2013 by EliteShadowLeo
Woopsie

To me it looks like a site for a Rocket Builders corporation (quick search gave no result for IAIA though). Quite cute, well done, enjoyed the read. Lots of several funny little tidbits like engine warranty is 2 years or until it leaves the ground, carrier pidgeon as 'contact us' choice, engines may contain small parts and are not suitable for children under 3 months as they present a choking hazard, etc.

Also shipping is for all Kerbin locations, offworld shipping not available.

Yep, quite cute, no threat whatsoever (edit: personal opinion).

Edited November 4, 2013 by Johnno
clarification

that was actually pretty funny.

I wonder who's behind this - seems like one massively overbuilt joke, if it's really just for lolz.

my guess it that's maybe still a WIP... for what purpose exactly, i can't tell

I wonder who's behind this - seems like one massively overbuilt joke, if it's really just for lolz.

It's registered to one Euan Mutch, who does a bit of YouTube gaming but oddly doesn't have any videos about KSP. Seems the clan is geared towards "gaming content on youtube". Part of some sort of video series maybe?

Edited November 4, 2013 by RunningGloves

Really, a Mainsail for Ã‚Â£850000, a Skipper for Ã‚Â£749000 etc.? Does anyone take this seriously?

Great joke though!

Really, a Mainsail for Ã‚Â£850000, a Skipper for Ã‚Â£749000 etc.? Does anyone take this seriously?

Great joke though!

The prices may be as if you're buying the parts for 'real life' use. If you consider it that way then they're ridiculously underpriced.

The prices may be as if you're buying the parts for 'real life' use. If you consider it that way then they're ridiculously underpriced.

Yeah, but whether the prices are based on RL or Rocket Builders, they are way out of sync both ways.
I purchased a Poodle engine. Sadly, delivery will be within 1 decade

I purchased a Poodle engine. Sadly, delivery will be within 1 decade

Unless you live on Kerbin I'm not sure they'll deliver it to you!

Their payment and shipping section cracks me up;

The IAIA ships to all locations across Kerbin. Shipping costs are kept to a minimum and are included in the price of all products.

Large items are shipped via the IAIA's specialised Circularised Re-entry Automated Parcel service (CRAP service). Please select a postal address clear of populated areas to minimise fatalities on delivery.

We regret that off-world shipping is not currently supported.

Someone must have out quite a bit of time into this, and I bet they where laughing to themselves all the way!
The kerbal internet is leaking to our own.
This is great, someone has a good sense of humour.
